Package embedding

Class CorrelationEvaluation

java.lang.Object
embedding.CorrelationEvaluation
public class CorrelationEvaluation
extends java.lang.Object
This class contains methods for evaluating, how good well two matrices or an embedding and a distance matrix correlate. The rating is done by calculating the residual variance.

When calculating the correlation between an embedding and a distance matrix, the distance matrix does not have to be quadratic. In that case only the correlation between the given distances and the corresponding distances in the embedding are taken into account.

Author:
Anton Ballmaier

  • Method Details

    • embeddingDistances

      public static double[][] embeddingDistances​(double[][] embedding, int requiredWidth)
      Calculates the euclidean distances between the vectors of an embedding. The number of distance calculations can be adjusted using the requiredWidth Parameter. Only distances from the first requiredWidth embedding vectors to all the others are calculated.
      Parameters:
      embedding - the coordinates of the embedding vectors
      requiredWidth - the number of points for which the distances must be calculated.
      Returns:
      the distance matrix of the embedding vectors

    • embeddingQuality

      public static double embeddingQuality​(double[][] distances, double[][] embedding)
      Inspects the quality of an embedding from a distance matrix to the euclidean space.

      The quality is rating is the residual variance of the embedding distances and the original distance matrix. 0 indicates a perfect embedding, 1 indicates that there is no correlation at all. In general lower values stand for better embeddings.

      When calculating the embedding quality, the given the distance matrix does not have to be quadratic. In that case only the correlation between the given distances and the corresponding distances in the embedding are taken into account.

      Parameters:
      distances - the original distance matrix
      embedding - the embedding
      Returns:
      the quality of the embedding

    • residualVariance

      public static double residualVariance​(double[][] a, double[][] b)
      Calculates the residual variance between to matrices of equal dimensions. This can be used as a measure of correlation.
      Parameters:
      a - the first matrix
      b - the second matrix
      Returns:
      their residual variance
